Wristkey is a free and open-source Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) app designed for Wear OS smartwatches, allowing users to generate OTPs directly from their wrist. It also supports phone usage and offers secure local storage and encrypted transfers.

LiftShift is a free, open-source web application that converts workout logs from various fitness apps (like Hevy and Strong) into actionable insights. It provides interactive muscle heatmaps, calendar filtering, progress cards, plateau detection, and detailed exercise analysis.

RedCoffee is a Python-based command-line interface (CLI) tool designed to generate PDF reports from SonarQube Community Edition analysis data. It addresses the lack of native PDF export functionality in the community edition, making it easier to share and review code quality metrics.

Kodus AI is an open-source AI agent designed to perform code reviews, mimicking the thoroughness of a senior developer. It integrates with Git workflows to learn codebase specifics and team standards, providing automated, context-aware feedback on pull requests to improve code quality, catch bugs, and enforce best practices.

ğŸ“ ğ—”ğ—•ğ—¢ğ—¨ğ—§ ğ—§ğ—›ğ—œğ—¦ ğ—£ğ—¥ğ—¢ğ—ğ—˜ğ—–ğ—§

Mussel is an interpreted, dynamically typed programming language written in Rust, designed for simplicity, readability, and powerful expression evaluation. It offers features like data types, functions, control flow, and a standard library, aiming for a balance between Rust's safety and speed with Python's ease of use.
